sentences.english: Today I no see police in (to be) in city.
sentences.chinese: 今天我不看员警在是城市。

sentences.english: A swarthy pock-marked man jumped out from behind the policemen and howled for them to attack.
sentences.chinese: 从员警背后突然跳出一个黑麻子来，怒声喝打。

sentences.english: So I don't know if they were police or maybe Tibetans.
sentences.chinese: 所以我不知道他们是员警还是藏民。

sentences.english: The policeman is commanding traffic on the traffic island.
sentences.chinese: 安全岛上的员警正在指挥交通。

sentences.english: However, as long as police officers through, it will immediately jump fawning.
sentences.chinese: 不过，只要有员警经过，它就会立刻跳起来摇尾乞怜。

sentences.english: Private members attack the government for not spend enough money on the police.
sentences.chinese: 下院议员批评政府没有在员警身上花足够的钱。

definition: police station (abbr. for 警察署[jing3 cha2 shu3])
police department/police station/abbr. of 警察局
variant of 保鏢|保镖[bao3 biao1]
to receive a report/to receive intelligence, information etc
alleged killer (or attacker)/suspect in a case of violent crime
National Police Agency (Taiwan)/abbr. for 內政部警政署|内政部警政署[Nei4 zheng4 bu4 Jing3 zheng4 shu3]
